message.content:
An otter is a semi-aquatic mammal belonging to the family Mustelidae. 
It has thick fur that varies in color from brown to gray, with a lighter underbelly. 
The fur is a dense and waterproof layer that helps it stay warm in cold water. 
Otters have webbed feet and a streamlined body that facilitates their swimming and diving abilities. 
They have a long, pointed snout and small ears located behind the eyes. 
Otters can be found in both freshwater and marine habitats, ranging from North America to Asia. 
They are known for their playful behavior and are often spotted playing in the water.
